page.title: 03HOUSING IN DOUNE
page.content: The village of Doune is made up of a variety of houses. Some are council houses, some privately owned, some are flats and some Victorian mansions. One, possibly the oldest in the district, is a fortified house, Newtown of Doune, where Sir Walter Scott once stayed and Bonnie Prince Charlie called at in 1745, and another two have recently been converted from a disused church. The centre of the village around the cross is made up of terraced cottages hundreds of years old, some of which were still thatched until 50 years ago; on the edge of the village a national builder has constructed detached villas and bungalows and attracted many new familes often with school age children, all within the last 15 years.
